UB_ITRONCC_CUSTOMER.description: Property number, which is the unique identifier in the Itron Customer Care system for the Customer data element. Mandatory.

Name of the customer, not the business (as was decided in the original design).  The Itron Customer Care system searches by customer name using this field instead of the first/middle/last name, so this name should be the property owner instead of the names for the business.
Hard-coded as 'RES' because Tempest does not store this data.

If the last names of both owners (in a joint-owner situation) are the same, then this will contain first_name1 || ' / ' || first_name2 (ex. Jim / Jane), otherwise just use the primary owner's first name.
The middle initial of the primary owner.

The last name of the primary owner, and if multiple owners exist on the property then the owner count (tdg_owner_count) will be appended to indicate to the Itron system that there are other owners on this property.
The start date of the owner. The stop date of the owner. This is the system date and time that this record was last changed on. Mandatory.

UB_ITRONCC_SP.description: Unique ID pointing to the utility account / meter group combination.  The Service Point is static, but the meters on that Service Point can change. Because of this, a Service Point is never considered to 'turn off' in the Itron Customer Care system even if there are no meters using the Service Point (it is still active and still exists). Itron explained that a Service Point is used to identify a pipe that goes from the main water line

UB_SERVICE_CONTROL.description: This flag defines if the charge is to ALWAYS be a DEBIT (this would be a normal charge) or CREDIT (this would be used for charges like Waivers or Special rebates). If a charge is flagged as a DEBIT then you CANNOT enter a credit amount (this can only occur by reversing an existing debit charge).  NOTE - an INTERIM charge could also be entered as a CREDIT.
For miscellaneous type charges a default amount may be defined.  For all other charges this field should be NULL. None. <ANON_RULE>DO NOTHING</ANON_RULE> </TDG_ANON>

UB_SERVICES.description: This is the number of units of the charge to be applied once the charge has been calculated.  If NULL use 1 unit.  For split location duplex type accounts you would use a units value of  0.5 for each customer to cause the charge to be split between the two customers. <ANON_RULE>DO NOTHING</ANON_RULE> </TDG_ANON>

UB_TRANSACTION_DETAILS.description: Country that the address belongs to for this transaction. The address is currently used on refund type transactions to record the address of the people a refund cheque is to be mailed to. Identified the country that the postal code is for. CAN is for Canadian postal code, US is for 5 digit or 5:4 digit zip code and INTL means the address is international and the postal code is NULL.

UB_VT_DECLARATION_DATA_ITEMS.description: This flag is used to identify whether the data item was connected to a declaration that was canceled. Canceling a declaration can happen in two ways: 1. The Cancel Declaration button was selected, causing the completed Declaration to be canceled and the status set back to PENDING. 2. The Declaration No Longer Required button was selected, causing the completed Declaration to be set to N/A - DECLARATION NO LONGER REQUIRED.
